main event: A sighting of a white or light-colored object in the NW sky, which appeared to be six or more feet in diameter with a dazzling light in the center. The object was observed moving slowly and appeared to be a balloon.
interesting points: The sighting occurred 5 miles west of Greenwood, La. on 12/30/52.
The object was reported to be moving slowly in the NW sky and appeared to be around six or more feet in diameter with a dazzling light in the center.
Conclusions from the report suggest that the object was definitely a balloon, supported by additional information on its behavior and appearance.
There were efforts to investigate the sighting with no results, and it was believed to be a weather balloon.
The report involves the accounts of multiple individuals including Michael A. Good, S. Collende, H. Moore, and LT. Exepat S. Director.
sighted object: white or light-colored object with a dazzling light in the center
witnesses: Michael A. Good, S. Collende, H. Moore, LT. Exepat S. Director
